page.title: 01HIGHTOWN-INTRODUCTION
page.content: {Hightown}is a small commuter settlement situated on the{South West {Lancashire}coast midway between {Southport}and{Liverpool.}The village has expanded rapidly in the last ten years with many new private houses being built for the commuters of {Liverpool. The region is dominated by{arable {farming.}The fertile drained{peat {soils}are ideal for the production of {market garden crops,}wheat and barley. The heavier clay soils being used for permanent pasture for{dairy cattle. The fertility of the region depends heavily on the{artificial drainage system with ditches controlling the level of the water-table in the fields. Overall the level of water in the ditches depends on the{River Alt which is done by the{barrage}of the {pumping station}at Hightown.
